author: graymattr
title: Extra Dots are the example
review:
I'm a grown man who uses power tools, chainsaws, and small engines on a regular basis and I love the Extra Dots sets.  You get a variety of fun colours, interesting shapes, and a handful of playful printed tiles.  The printed tiles are the main attraction for me.  The sport theme of Series 7 includes some great tiles of balls with happy faces, some slogans, and some animals ready to play a game. 

Besides the fact that I love the sets, here's why bothered to write and why I titled this review "Extra Dots are the example" -- these polybags have a window in the lower right corner that lets you preview the "surprise" dots inside.  I wish the CMF figures did this!  I would be happy if the Extra Dots contained the same number of printed tiles in each bag if there were no window because you would still know what you're getting.  But because Lego mixes them up, the window is my key to picking the bags that have the printed tiles I want.  You might have to make some tradeoffs in finding a bag that has a tile you may not care for, but you know what you're getting. 

I was able to pick a bag that had three soccer ball tiles and two track shoe tiles.  Awesome!  Why?  Because I have three boys who all played high school soccer and two of them ran on the track team.  It's like the Lego sorting machine was thinking of me when it filled this bag!  ;-)  Maybe you want the roller skate or the sloth, you can find them inside with the window.
